document_data.caption: Westwood and the Sword Mountains.
document_data.name: Westwood
document_data.mainbody: '''Westwood''' was a forest on the [[Sword Coast North]] on the eastern edge of the [[Sword Mountains]].
document_data.Geography:
The closest settlement to Westwood was [[Kheldell]], which sat on the northwestern edge of the wood at the bottom of the Sword Mountains. [[Amphail (village)|Amphail]] lay to the south of Westwood.

Westwood was part of a group of forests that were referred to by some as the [[Other Woods]] and others as the [[Moonwoods]]. The forests in this group were [[Lurkwood]], [[Southkrypt Garden]],<ref group="note">Both sources use this name of a dwarven ruin but it is assumed to mean the [[Kryptgarden Forest]] in which it was located. [[Southwood]], [[Moonwood]], and Westwood.
document_data.History:
Some sages claimed that Westwood was once as vast as the [[High Forest]] and stretched as far north as [[Yartar]] and as far south as the [[Delimbiyr Route]].

In {{Yearlink|-4420}}, the dwarven realm of [[Besilmer]] was founded. The western edges of Besilmer's territory ended at Westwood.

In {{Yearlink|-1100}}, the remnants of the [[elf|elven]] empire of [[Illefarn]] splintered into the independent realms of [[Ardeep]], [[Iliyanbruen]], and [[Rilithar]]. Rilithar settled Westwood and [[Kryptgarden Forest]].

Sages claimed that Westwood had been shrinking after the destruction of [[Netheril]].

Some time between [[936 DR]] and [[941 DR]], the [[Battle of Westwood]] took place. This battle was part of the [[Orcfastings War]]. During the battle, [[King Uruth]] was killed<ref name ="CoS:W-8"> while wielding the ''[[Ettin Axe of Uruth]]''.<ref name ="CoS:W-147">

Around [[1370 DR]], a group of druids known as the [[Dusk Circle]] lived in the Westwood. These druids directed the lumberjacks of Kheldell as to when and where they could chop trees.<ref name ="VGttN-50"/>
document_data.Notable Locations:
;Elven Castle
:As of 1370 DR, rumor had it that there was a ruined [[elf|elven]] castle at the center of Westwood. The ruins supposedly held [[magic]] and were inhabited by [[owlbear]]s and [[treant|wild tree]]s. The route to the ruin was supposedly marked by floating [[moonglow]] symbols that were only visible at night.

;Shrine of Mielikki
:As of 1370 DR, there was a hidden shrine to [[Mielikki]] in Westwood. Only rangers were guided to the shrine. Those who left certain offerings at the altar were rewarded with either healing spells or curses depending on their alignment.
